Reviews.Content: Ramada Hotel Great One night stay at Ramada Hotel. At first not too happy due to reviews read. However, we arrived at the hotel before 8am. Not only did they check us in, but also upgraded us to a business room. What was great about the room is kettle, etc. Receptionist assisted with available tours. Hotel 3 blocks away from main entrance of main train station. Short walk and easy to find. Some reviewers complained about red light area....the only red light I saw was the traffic light!Buffet breakfast good.The only frustration was that all the channels on TV was German.
Reviews.Author: Terblaam

Reviews.Content: Nice and clean The hotel is quite conveniently located in the town center and has clean, modern and spacious rooms. Definitely liked it pretty much.
Reviews.Author: mrpatchy

Reviews.Content: very disapointed hi,myself and my boyfriend booked this hotel for a romantic break. we arrived late on a friday night and was told the hotel had made a mistake with the booking and we had to stay in a nearby hotel. i was assured it was the same standard and given an upgrade, free internet use and free mini bar. we went to the comfort hotel and it was a dump. the rooms were tiny, the place was grotty it was the worst hotel room i have ever seen. i immediatly rang the ramada to complain. they called me back offering a room the next day. I made my complaints known but it was only when i highlighted that a staff member had lied about the other hotels rating, that the laptop was stolen from the comfort hotel so they had no internet access and that i had taken photos to post on this site that they gave an upgrade.This room was small but done to a high standard. We had no problems after this but as hotel star ratings are self classified, 1-2 star hotels advertise as 4 star. i am not generally fussy but the room in the comfort hotel was the worst i have seen and it is disgraceful that the ramada attempt to send customers there. since the superior room in the ramada is small, the standard must also be tiny.
Reviews.Author: pollyIreland

Reviews.Content: Nice cosy hotel Stayed here for 2 nights during the Christmas markets. The hotel is really central being only a few minutes walk from the HauptBahnhof and nothing more than a 10 or 15 minute stroll from the Altstadt where everything was happening.The room we were given was pretty small but comfortable. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom/shower was relatively large and very clean.All the staff were friendly and helpful whenever we needed them.There were renovations taking place in the hotel at the time but there was very little noise or disruption despite this.The buffet breakfast which was included in our stay was very good even if there was a slight queue at the tea/coffee making facilities.Overall my girlfriend and I were delighted with this little hotel especially since our booking cost us less than 鈧?20 for two nights
Reviews.Author: NeanderthalBoy

Reviews.Content: Disappointing Stay at Ramada Hotel was built into several old buildings in a seedy neighborhood near the train station (Hauptbahnhof). Rooms are small and very difficult to get to through obscure corridors with several small staircases inbetween. Restaurant for breakfast is disappointing. Few facilities in hotel or in room. Not recommended for familes or young travelers.
Reviews.Author: Zed3NC

Reviews.Content: Motel Ramada This may appear from internet to be a business-like hotel, with decent, standard, clean rooms. The price they charge makes one think that the hotel is luxury. But the rooms are below motel standards. They are dark, too hot, obscenely humid - there's no air conditioning, only an old fan in the middle of the room you can use to survive - and there is no desk, no closets, drawers, anything that you usually have in a motel room.The bathroom is dirty and feels the weights of its many decades.It looks like internet may be free from the website, but it's exceedingly expensive.The location is fine, near the station, ok if you have to rush to catch a flight. Otherwise any other location in Frankfurt would be better. I have stayed in many other hotels in Frankfurt, paying as low as 28, 30, 40 euros and they all beat this expensive pretentious place.
Reviews.Author: UomodiMondo

Reviews.Content: Nice!       At the hotel facade.
Reviews.Author: citizen132002

Reviews.Content: functional but no more- a budget hotel without budget price       bedroom photo 1
Reviews.Author: whackerD

Reviews.Content: There are better choices in better neighbourhoods I have stayed here with a friend during the Frankfurt Book Fair, a time frame, when hotel prices climb high up. The room I was shown to first, was most unwelcoming, next to shabby and smelling badly. The receptionist eventually helped me into a business room against paying the upgrade. This was a smallish room with no hallway (on entering you stood right in front of the twin bed), a small closet, a small desk, a flat screen tv, one telephone (with fax) at the desk. It showed toward the street and had no direct sunshine. The view was interesting but given the still red-light-attached neighbourhood it was noisy at times at night. No cars, but noisy pedestrians.The bathroom had a window, which was a plus. But there was no bath tub, only a shower. The mini-bar was half empty on arrival. No amenities like bathrobe, slippers, sewing kit or shoe polish were in visible sight.Breakfast in the mornings was basic and service was next to indifferent. On Sunday morning tooth picks were left from the evening before on the bench, a stain from cigarettes (?) on one table cloth and the man who fries eggs for breakfast had not arrived until 8.30 (breakfast started at 7.00 on Sundays).The receptionists were kind but did not seem to be very knowledgeable.So, no convincing impressions regarding the basic room, quality of breakfast and service will let me choose another hotel in Frankfurt/Main for my next stay.
Reviews.Author: Zurich

Reviews.Content: Seen better jails While the staff was very friendly, the room itself was the worst I'd ever stayed in. The size of a cell - literally. Very hard, narrow twin bed against the wall; lying in bed I could reach the wall on the other side also. No chair, one small blanket, one small pillow. Clean and okay if you just want to sleep, but no place to sit, read, etc. Near park, train station, museums. Mainly Asian or Middle Eastern restaurants in walking distance.
Reviews.Author: JillianS

Reviews.Content: Christmas Markets We stayed in this hotel to visit frankfurts christmas markets. hotel was very nice, close to station and around ten minutes walk to markets. Did seem like the hotel was suited more to business travellers but reception staff very friendly. Rooms were great, modern and clean. Only single fault was the room service, nobody answered phone, but as we very rarely use the service it didnt bother us too much, did end up paying 11eur for a tiny bowl of nasty soup in end tho lol
Reviews.Author: jade83

Reviews.Content: frozen I have reserved a room for my general manager and now feel embrassed and responsible.Because she was nearly frozen! The heating system didn't work she says. She slept with her jumper in the bed! Maybe this is the only disadvantage of this hotel but I think it is a big problem,especially at -2C...
Reviews.Author: carmenAnkara

Reviews.Content: Perfect for a visit to Frankfurt Just a single night but difficult to find fault with this hotel. Easy to locate and just a few minutes walk from the train station. Super staff and a pleasant experience from check in to check out. The rooms are spotless and have TV, free safe, tea and coffee, iron and board, phone, minibar, writing desk comfortable beds and lovely shower room with all the extras and a fluffy towel. It has the slowest lift in Germany but hey, who's in a hurry on holiday? Must finish by mentioning the breakfast which is included and leaves nothing to be desired, even an egg bar where you can have omlettes or fried eggs freshly prepared to order.
Reviews.Author: jovialmonkeybusiness

Reviews.Content: christmas markets Great hotel, 10 min walk from Christmas markets, main train station 3 mins walk. We got a business twin room, absolutely spotless, mini bar, safe, power shower, for 53.00pps for weekend nights. The breakfast was plentiful and the staff were incredibly nice and helpful. Also friends had dinner in restaurant and were very impressed. Would recommend this one highly for a stay in frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: rufusbuddy

Reviews.Content: Good hotel, fantastic location Stayed at the Ramada Hotel City Center in Frankfurt when i went to catch the World Cup in June.This hotel 's location is great, 5 min walk to the main train station.And around the hotel, there are many small cafes, restaurants, fast food joints, mini supermarkets..Although the red light district is not far from the hotel, i think it's not a problem as long as you do not go out till wee hours in the morning.The hotel is within walking distance ( 15-20min ) to Zeil, Frankfurt's main shopping district. Alternatively, you can hop onto the tram ( tram stop 1min walk from hotel ), alight at the Old Town, Romerberg, and walk to Zeil in less than 5 min.This hotel has a new tower which they opened in June during the World Cup. We were lucky to get rooms in the new tower as all rooms are air-conditioned. There is a small LCD tv in the room, boiler (kettle), mini bar, in-room safe and hair-dryer.Overall, i would give this hotel 8 out of 10.
Reviews.Author: llhpaolo

Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE room This Ramada is in a very small, old building. It's in the 'red light' area but this didn't bother me... only a few hundred meters from the train station, so if you're overnighting, the area doesn't matter.However...the room was awful. It was TINY - I have seen larger hamster cages. I felt like I was in a prison cell or college dorm room (except dorm rooms are bigger). Could barely turn around to close the door, hang up clothes, etc. I was practically banging my elbows. And the room had a strange smell, which never went away.The telephone rates are EXTORTIONATE -- something like $14 for the first minute, to the US, and like many hotels they have the phone system rigged up so that you CANNOT call anywhere collect. I had to go down the street to a phone place just to make my calls.Staff were friendly, but because of the room I just couldn't wait to get out of there. I would not recommend to anyone that you stay here unless you're desperate.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not a great area at night This hotel was okay. The rooms are typical teeny Euro-style, but the room was in fine order. The hotel is close to the square and the European Central Bank. However, I was told by several people once I arrived in Frankfurt that the area around the hotel becomes a red-light and junkie district at night and should definately be avoided. Just make sure you take a cab if it's after dark.Breakfast was okay, but I was expecting a bit more of a traditional German breakfast - it had a selection of German sandwhich meats, cereal, toast, jam, and eggs.
Reviews.Author: cornetml

Reviews.Content: Visit to Christmas Markets in Frankfurt Very good reasonable hotel. Nice rooms absolutely spotless. Staff were helpful and breakfast was excellent.Good central location within walking distance from the old area, the main shopping street and the train station.No nice views from any of the windows but made up for by central location. Red light district is hardly noticable a couple of blocks away. Heidelburg is near by train beautiful and well worth a visit.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great hotel i really enjoyed my stay here in downtown frankfurt. i booked a economy single room for 56 euro's per night through (---).now the room was very small but for 1 person it was just perfect. the room had a mini bar and a very nice size bathroom.the breakfast witch is included was excellant. the hotel does have a restaurant but i didnt eat there as there are many restaurants right outside the hotel and on the next street over there is 3 different bars you can have a nice german beer in. now this hotel is like 3 blocks away from the red light district, but i walked all around at night by myself and had no problem at all. you can walk to the main train station in no more than 5 minutes. i think it was also 3 blocks away.i will for surely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: markh

Reviews.Content: MEIDEN, wenn dann nur im ABC Schutzanzug   showReview(20152153, 'full');
